conversations.content: Yes, I should be able to cook all manner of dishes with these utensils.
And with this light, breathable outfit on my back, I am ready to set out!
Goodness, Cleo. Where are you off to with all of this gear?
Oh, just a little mountain camping trip.
Mountains?! Camping?! Trip?! YOU?!
Is that truly so shocking?
Aside from the fact you are not known to enjoy climbing mountains in the slightest, you mean?
True, it's not my favorite activity...
But it'll be worth it for all of the wonderful new foods I will be able to gather!
What brought all this on?
Well...
Is this a rice ball?
Yes, but it's a FIEND rice ball! Mitsuba and I made them.
Yep! We really just want you to be able to join our little fiendmeat party.
When you share delicious food with everyone, it only makes it better!
I had been avoiding fiend cuisine due to its appearance—as well as my own prejudices on the subject.
But thanks to Pecorine, I learned not to judge things before I can try them.
Now I suspect there to be an entire world of things I've long assumed inedible that are actually quite tasty.
When I think about that, I can scarce sit still.
Which explains the camping trip. Speaking of which, might I come with?
If anything unforeseen should happen, two can handle it better than one.
I would be glad for the company!
We've hiked quite a ways today. Shall we take a break?
*pant* *gasp* *wheeze* No, I am fine...
You're practically out of breath, Cleo— and no wonder when your pack weighs more than a dragon! We're stopping.
Please, let's just climb a little higher. I hear the foraging is better the closer one gets to the top of the mountain.
You are a woman possessed when food is involved...
Are you sure you're well, Cleo? You look rather unsteady.
*sputter* I'm fine! Stronger than ever in fac—WHOOOOA!
Cleo, look out!
Elisanne!
Don't let go! I'll pull you up! Nnnngh... Blast! You're slipping!
Elisanne, wait! I'll unhook my pack!
*pant* *gasp* You saved me...
*gasp* *pant* Thank goodness...
I'm sorry I couldn't lift both you and your possessions, Cleo.
Say no more about it. If I'd not let my pack go, I would be splattered at the bottom of the cliff along with my possessions.
I'm simply grateful you helped me.
Your pack WAS incredibly heavy. What exactly was in it, anyway?
Let me think... Four portable cooking pots, two cast-iron skillets, a knife, charcoal, a cutting board, cooking oil—
You brought ALL of that?!
I wanted to be able to cook up whatever I found right where I found it—though perhaps I was overthinking the issue, now that I look back on it.
I'm impressed you made it this far with such immense weight on your back.
I know you're passionate about cooking, but that is a mad amount of equipment to haul up a mountai—*gurgle*
Goodness! I fear all this talk of cooking has my stomach rumbling.
Mine seems to be doing the same. I wonder if there is anything we can make around here.
Did we not just lose all of our cookware?
Oh, I'm certain I'll think of something. First, let's see what we can forage!
I was able to find a few varieties of nuts and mushrooms, as well as wild greens.
All edible, but certainly not easy to eat in their current state.
The wild greens especially will be quite bitter if we don't cook them first.
And yet, as we have established, our cookware is at the bottom of a cliff.
Perhaps we could heat up a flat rock and use it as a frying pan.
A fine idea! Let us find a suitable stone and see if the plan bears fruit.
Putting a flat rock on top of a campfire to cook food was a good idea, but...
But the food is stuck to the rock and burning. Badly, I might add.
We need oil—or a substitute.
Elisanne, where are the nuts you found?
I set them aside after I tried to eat one and nearly cracked a tooth in two.
They might be too hard for eating, but we can still use them for oil!
If we crush them with this rock... Yes, look! Oil! Quickly, pour that on the flat rock that is our frying pan!
Oh, that smells lovely!
Now our food won't stick. Let's try this again...
...Done! A stone-grilled sauté!
It looks and smells fantastic, Cleo. I cannot wait to try it.
*chomp* Oh, but this is divine... And to think we made it from items we foraged from the mountainside!
I'm glad you like it, though I'm sorry I couldn't make anything more extravagant.
I should have listened to you and taken a break. If I had, we'd still have all my cookware and ingredients.
Don't worry about that, Cleo. In fact, the experience taught me a valuable lesson.
And what is that?
You told me there was a world of things you'd assumed were inedible that could actually be quite tasty, remember?
Well, I'm impressed by your innovation. Take the nuts, for example. Not only did the oil do its job, it was delicious as well!
I would have just given up on them, figuring they were inedible.
What, that? I just happened to know that similar nuts could be used in such a way.
And your knowledge has left me with a very full stomach.
Also, I haven't even mentioned your idea to use a flat rock as a frying pan.
I'm confident you could whip up a fine meal in ANY situation!
Elisanne, thank you.
But who knows what the future holds? Being able to cook well in the wild might prove a handy skill indeed.
At least we know we won't go hungry.
And perhaps I can get even better at campfire cooking!
You never ask to come along when I go find new merchandise, Cleo. What gives?
Shrewd Merchant Francesca
I'm hoping to get my hands on some ingredients I usually struggle to find.
Hmm. Well, I definitely know of places where you can find rare and unique delicacies, but that still doesn't explain why you're suddenly into this now.
I want to expand my cooking horizons. Who knows what sort of ingredients I might encounter out on assignment?
I see, I see.
Well, like I said, I think I know just the place to take you!
Heavens, look at all these mushrooms and medicinal herbs!
Amazing, right? I learned about the place from a trader friend of mine.
And you're letting me in on the secret?!
Of course! I have a good relationship with 'em, so I'm free to use this place however I see fit.
Be that for my own supplies, or as a bargaining chip.
I'm sorry, a bargaining chip?
Indeed. Oh, which reminds me...
Yes?
Look, you and me are good pals and all, but I'm still gonna need a little something in return for showing you this place.
Think maybe you could help me pick out some medicinal herbs for my wares? You've got a knack for that sorta thing.
Heh. That sounds like a fair trade to me.
Right then! Where should we begin?
Hey, howzabout a break before we head into town so I can sell this stuff?
Of course. Also, thank you again for today, if I haven't been clear on that front.
You helped me get my hands on some truly unique ingredients!
And YOUR help picking out those medicinal herbs was invaluable!
You're so quick and precise! If it were me, I'd have been standing there scratching my head till the sun went down.
Which reminds me, I need to note this new inventory in my ledger.
Er, this is going to take a bit, Cleo. You mind waiting a little longer?
Is there anything I can do to help?
Seriously? Well, I suppose you could cut the stems off these mushrooms.
Can you not sell them as they are?
Yeah, the stems are pretty tough eating, so they tend to sell better without 'em.
Ah, I see.
Oh, and could you split these blue plums in two and take out the pits?
They'll sell better if they're pitted and preserved in sugar.
This all feels rather like a waste of food.
Customers want things that are ready to eat and easy to cook; it saves them time.
I understand the sentiment, but...
(But it really IS a waste.)
(Is there anything I can do? Oh, of course!)
Francesca, would it be all right for me to take the leftover bits once we're done with the prepwork?
Sure, knock yourself out. Er, but mind if I ask why?
I'm going to make us lunch!
People don't like these mushroom stems because they are dry and flavorless, yes?
But that's no reason they wouldn't taste wonderful in a spicy soup!
Yeah, I suppose dryness doesn't matter in a soup—and if it's spicy enough, the flavor won't, either.
And at the same time, they will provide much-needed texture.
Pretty smart there, Cleo. So what about the plum pits?
They're too hard and bitter to eat as-is, but they have a lovely fragrance.
I plan to break them up into chips and roast them on an open fire.
*sniff* Mmm, that smoke is lovely.
Indeed. And now I will use it to smoke this leaf-wrapped fish.
This all smells INSANE!
Please, dig in.
Don't mind if I do!
*munch* Okay, THAT is legit good. It doesn't taste fishy at all!
Wonderful! I roasted some herbs that counteract fishiness along with the plum pits, so I'm happy it worked.
You know, I bet I could use this to keep fish fresh over long distances!
I can't believe you managed to turn a bunch of stuff I was gonna toss out into marketable goods. This is a major score!
Being quick is all well and good, but not wasting food is also a key part of being a great chef.
The more food there is to eat, the fewer people go hungry.
As a purveyor of fine foods, I wanna take those words and tattoo them on my face! ...I mean, not literally. But you know.
Say, have you ever thought of collecting  your recipes in a book?
What?!
Yeah, a book! Your food-saving ways would be invaluable for households that are struggling to make ends meet.
It would be an instant best seller, and I'd be happy to give you the lion's share of the profits.
Heck, we could make a special edition signed by you for some added value. Or maybe even hold a signing!
Um, I will...think about it.
Wow! What a gorgeous vista!
Budding Artist Fleur
Thanks so much for bringing me all the way up here, Cleo.
Of course. I was just thinking it was time for another foraging trip anyway.
It's not always easy to get this far away from the castle, is it?
Well I can't let this go to waste. Time to break out the sketch pad!
Hmm? Are you all right, Fleur? The color has gone from your cheeks.
Has it? Weird. I feel completely fine!
Well, if you say so...
I'm gonna go over there and sketch. See ya in a bit!
Maybe I'm worrying for no reason... Regardless, I should go look for edibles.
Goodness, it's past midday already. We should think about heading back.
Have you finished your sketches, Fleur?
Sure have! I'm at a good stopping point right now, so...um...
Uuuurgh... I feel dizzy... The world's going all spinny...
Fleur!
Nnnngh...
Fleur, what's wrong?!
My tummy hurts... I feel gross.
Did you eat something strange?
Nuh uh. I haven't eaten all day.
All DAY?!
I was so focused on my art, I didn't even think about food.
So you haven't eaten ANYTHING?!
No wonder you feel terrible.
Graaaargh!
Fiends?! Oh, why now?!
...Wait, that's it.
Look, I know it might seem weird, but I promise I can whip these fiends up into a dish that will have you drooling all over the forest floor. DROOLING.
And there we have it... Fiendmeat miso porridge, packed full of all the medicinal herbs a girl could need!
Fiendmeat is full of nutrients!
When Pecorine collapsed, the porridge we made got her back on her feet.
GRAAAAAGH!
Sorry, friend. Looks like this isn't going to be your lucky day.
But Fleur needs to eat!
Here, Fleur. I made you some healthy fiendmeat porridge. Can you eat?
Mmm, it smells great... *chomp*
I'm glad you like it. Can you eat more?
*chomp* *slurp* Aaaaaah!
Are you all right, Fleur? What's wrong?
Cleo, it's... It's AMAZING!
Even with my tummy hurting, I can totally snarf it down!
Porridge is the best thing when you're  eating for the first time after a long fast.
I'm sure your stomach was hurting from hunger, but make sure to eat slowly so you don't shock your system.
Yes, ma'am! *nibble*
Hee hee! I feel tons better now.
Fiendmeat restores the body's mana, and the herbs I mixed in are full of additional nutrients.
It's the perfect thing to get a person back on their feet.
Wow, Cleo. You're pretty great.
Thank you, Fleur. Er, but if I may ask, how long HAD it been since you last ate?
Hmm. Well, I spent all yesterday painting in my room, and the day before that I was painting in my room, sooo...I dunno?
It sounds like you didn't eat anything for two whole days.
I guess, yeah.
Fleur, I understand how easy it is to get lost in something you're passionate about, but you have to take care of yourself.
A growing girl like yourself needs proper nutrition.
'Kay, I'll be more careful.
So, um, does this mean you won't take me out to sketch again?
Of course it doesn't. So long as you're healthy about it, we can do this whenever you like.
REALLY?!
But you must promise to eat properly!
If you don't take care of yourself, you won't be able to keep doing things you enjoy.
Then I'll eat tons so I can grow up big and strong!
In that case, would you like seconds?
Yes, please!
This rain isn't letting up.
You've got that right.
It seems today will be a poor one for foraging after all. My apologies for misreading the weather.
It's not your fault, Cleo. Weather changes on a whim up here in the mountains.
I'm just glad we found this cave so we're out of the worst of it.
Now that we are here, might I ask why you wanted to come along in the first place?
Elisanne told me you were working on your outdoor cooking.
She said something about how you wanted to be able to make delicious things even if we had to camp unexpectedly.
She told you all that, did she?
Yep. And when I heard it, I thought it was a burden you shouldn't have to bear alone.
Heh. How very much like you... Well, thank you for the gesture.
Dear me, this rain really isn't stopping. We may end up camping here ourselves, and we didn't bring any supplies.
That's all right. I think I can go without eating for a night.
Are you certain?
Well, I won't exactly ENJOY it, but it's not going to kill me or anything.
Whether or not something ends in death should not be our measuring stick here!
Wait there, please. I will see if I can make something from what we gathered so far.
Ah! I can use these mushrooms to make the spicy soup I created for Francesca!
...Wow, Cleo, this looks great!
Please be careful! It is quite ho—
OW!
...hot.
*puff* *puff* Okay, it should be good now.
Thanks, Cleo—and sorry for the trouble.
Oh! Er, I mean, I am sorry as well. That was likely a bit forward of me...
Sorry?
J-just talking to myself! Please, eat up!
Don't have to ask me twice.
Well? How do you find it? I know some of the ingredients are a bit odd, but...
Cleo, it's DELICIOUS.
It warmed me right up, and the flavors nearly knocked me off my feet!
The mushrooms really make it hearty.
Francesca taught me about those  mushrooms, actually.
Usually people just eat the caps, but I found a way to make the stems appetizing.
Hey, if this is your idea of outdoor cooking, I hope we get to camp out every night.
Really? I can't promise the same variety of foods you'll get back home...
Actually, I think this was almost better than what we eat back at the Halidom.
What?! But I work so hard in the kitchen!
No, I didn't mean it like that! It's more like... How do I say this?
I think there are flavors you can ONLY get when you eat something at a campfire.
Ah, I see. I suppose the campfire does provide its own special ambiance.
And the company provides a little something extra as well.
Dining in the wild on a rainy day wouldn't be half as delicious if I wasn't with you!
I completely agree.
You do?!
Sure! It's always better to eat with friends.
And the more friends we have with us, the better this soup is going to get!
Cleo? Everything all right?
I should have known that was what you meant.
...What do you mean?
Nothing. Please don't worry about it.
But you're right that I hope to introduce this soup to more people.
I'm sure they'll love it—though I worry it might lose a little something if we just have it back at the castle.
Not to worry; I have an idea.
You do?
I do—but first, what other camping delicacies would you like to try?
We've a long night ahead of us, so... Euden, look outside!
The rain's let up! We can go home.
Yes, I suppose we can. Well then, you will simply have to tell me your requests on the way instead.
(It's something of a shame...)
(But I suppose I'll have to be satisfied with just that little appetizer.)
Ain't she done smokin' the meat yet?
I'm afraid you'll have to hold on a little bit longer, Ranzal.
I can't wait no longer! The soup's ready, yeah? It's just GOTTA be ready!
Praise Ilia, but you are a child sometimes. Cleo told us it needs to simmer for quite a while before serving, remember?
Well, hell. Guess I'll just stare at the fire and go hungry instead.
Still, who'da thunk the boss would suggest a camping party? I'm impressed!
It is certainly giving everyone a much-needed chance to unwind.
Good, clean air and good, clean food!  Heckuva combo! Good on ya, boss!
I appreciate the kind words, but I'm not the one who put this together.
Uh, so who did?
Cleo.
Cleo?!
Why are you so surprised?
Just didn't expect ya to be the drivin' force behind a wild shindig is all.
Even I have a desire to cut loose  every once in a while.
Additionally, this party will serve another important function.
How do you mean?
Well, you see... *sniff* Er, is something burning?
Whoopsie!
The smoked food is on fire! Put it out!
Oh no! The soup!
Forget the soup—we have to get this fire under control!
Phew! We managed to put it out.
Er, sorry about that. I shoulda been watching a little closer.
I must apologize as well. I knocked over the soup in my panic to put the fire out...
It's fine, Elly. No one was hurt, and that's all that matters.
Except the food's all burned to cinders and now we got nothin' to eat!
We threw every last ingredient we had into dinner. *sniff* Think I'm gonna cry...
Don't worry. I'll not let you go hungry.
As I was starting to say earlier, this party is going to serve an important function.
Did you notice anything special about the menu for tonight's event?
Not really.
Just that I wanted to eat all of it— but I guess that ain't unusual.
Oh I know! All of the ingredients are things that can be found in the mountains, woods, and lakes in this area.
Indeed. Nothing on tonight's menu was made from what we bought at the market.
Everything was naturally found in the wild. Therefore...
We can quickly replace everything that was lost by foraging near the shore!
Woooo!
This nature's-bounty stew is done!
Let's eat!
*chomp* So good! Three cheers for Cleo!
Hard to believe you just whipped this up!
I thought the herbs we gathered were  mere weeds, and yet they've cooked up rather pleasantly.
You really can make anything taste good.
It's a good thing I've had the chance to practice my outdoor cooking.
Why WERE ya doin' that anyway?
We're going to keep getting sent out on long assignments, and won't always be able to carry adequate supplies.
So I've been practicing foraging and preparing food in the wild.
Tonight's party was also about having all of you try your hand at some of the recipes I've thought up.
After all, I won't be able to accompany you on every trip.
Okay, but why bring us out to the lake? We could have learned just as well back at the Halidom.
But then you'd be missing out on the most important spice for this cuisine...
Eating outdoors, surrounded by friends. Right, Euden?
Right.
It certainly has been a lovely meal, despite how odd the ingredients are.
Perhaps one can only get this flavor while eating in nature with friends.
Yer damn right on that count!
I love me some outdoor grub!
Uh, Cleo? Our soup isn't turning out like yours at all. It's...very gross.
Can you maybe take a look and see what we did wrong?
Mind tasting ours and giving us some pointers as well?
I made a few'a my own tweaks and it turned out aaaaall right! ...Er, right?
Yes yes, please hold on. I'll be certain to come around to all of you in turn.
But first, please excuse me for a moment. Oh, but do give a shout if you need something urgent or light another thing on fire, yes?
Man, Cleo seems different.
I agree. Previously, she would always hang back from parties such as this.
But now she's right in the thick of things and having a great time. You think maybe all this outdoor cooking is the reason?
Yeah, I think so. I mean, I know she wanted to get better at this for us, but...
Well, I think it's helped her get CLOSER to all of us as well!
